channel.title: NPR Topics: National
channel.description: NPR coverage of national news, U.S. politics, elections, business, arts, culture, health and science, and technology. Subscribe to the NPR Nation RSS feed.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Report finds children with mental health diagnoses often incarcerated instead of getting treatment
item.description: Dozens of juvenile detention centers in 25 states reported holding children weeks or months as they awaited space at long-term psychiatric treatment facilities, according to a new survey.
item.content:encoded:
Dozens of juvenile detention centers in 25 states reported holding children weeks or months as they awaited space at long-term psychiatric treatment facilities, according to a new survey.

(Image credit: David Goldman)
item.dc:creator: Martin Kaste

item.title: What will the cities of tomorrow look like? These middle schoolers have thoughts
item.description: At the Illinois gathering of the Future City competition, 16 middle school teams presented their concepts for cutting-edge cities.
item.content:encoded: At the Illinois gathering of the Future City competition, 16 middle school teams presented their concepts for cutting-edge cities.
item.dc:creator: Kadin Mills

item.title: Mayor says lack of communication created concern and alarm in El Paso
item.description: NPR's Ailsa Chang speaks with El Paso Mayor Renard Johnson about the FAA's temporary closure of airspace over the city, and how it was communicated to city leaders.
item.content:encoded: NPR's Ailsa Chang speaks with El Paso Mayor Renard Johnson about the FAA's temporary closure of airspace over the city, and how it was communicated to city leaders.
item.dc:creator: Jordan-Marie Smith

item.title: What the data tells us about kidnapped people — and how Nancy Guthrie is an outlier
item.description: Nancy Guthrie is among the thousands of people who go missing in the U.S. each year. But experts describe her case as "strange," with many unique details, from her age to her celebrity daughter.
item.content:encoded: Nancy Guthrie is among the thousands of people who go missing in the U.S. each year. But experts describe her case as "strange," with many unique details, from her age to her celebrity daughter.
item.dc:creator: Bill Chappell

item.title: Chloe Kim's protégé foiled her Olympic three-peat dreams. She's celebrating anyway
item.description: Korea's Gaon Choi, 17, rebounded from a hard fall to win gold — and end her role model's historic bid for three in a row in the Winter Olympic halfpipe.
item.content:encoded:
Korea's Gaon Choi, 17, rebounded from a hard fall to win gold — and end her role model's historic bid for three in a row in the Winter Olympic halfpipe.

(Image credit: Cameron Spencer)
item.dc:creator: Rachel Treisman

item.title: 54-year-old U.S. curler sets new American Winter Olympics age record
item.description: Rich Ruohonen has tried to get to the Olympics for almost 40 years. He finally got his chance, taking to the ice at the Milan Cortina Games representing the U.S. on Team Casper for curling.
item.content:encoded:
Rich Ruohonen has tried to get to the Olympics for almost 40 years. He finally got his chance, taking to the ice at the Milan Cortina Games representing the U.S. on Team Casper for curling.

(Image credit: Odd Andersen)
item.dc:creator: Pien Huang

item.title: Federal judge orders return of Venezuelan migrants deported to El Salvador under Alien Enemies Act
item.description: In his Thursday order, U.S. District Court Judge James Boasberg ordered the government to allow any of the men deported last year to El Salvador to appear in a U.S. port of entry to be conditionally allowed in as they challenge their removal.
item.content:encoded:
In his Thursday order, U.S. District Court Judge James Boasberg ordered the government to allow any of the men deported last year to El Salvador to appear in a U.S. port of entry to be conditionally allowed in as they challenge their removal.

(Image credit: Valerie Plesch)
item.dc:creator: Sergio Martínez-Beltrán

item.title: Trump border czar Tom Homan announces Minnesota immigration surge is ending
item.description: The aggressive enforcement operation resulted in thousands of arrests, and two U.S. citizens were fatally shot in Minneapolis by federal immigration agents.
item.content:encoded:
The aggressive enforcement operation resulted in thousands of arrests, and two U.S. citizens were fatally shot in Minneapolis by federal immigration agents.

(Image credit: Steve Karnowski)
item.dc:creator: Gigi Douban

item.title: Trump's border czar signals end to immigration operation in Minnesota
item.description: Trump administration border czar Tom Homan said Thursday that the immigration surge that prompted widespread protests and claimed the lives of two U.S. citizens is drawing to a close.
item.content:encoded: Trump administration border czar Tom Homan said Thursday that the immigration surge that prompted widespread protests and claimed the lives of two U.S. citizens is drawing to a close.
item.dc:creator: Meg Anderson

item.title: How the FBI might have gotten inaccessible camera footage from Nancy Guthrie's house
item.description: Last week, law enforcement said video footage from Nancy Guthrie's doorbell camera was overwritten. But the FBI has since released footage as Guthrie still has not been found.
item.content:encoded:
Last week, law enforcement said video footage from Nancy Guthrie's doorbell camera was overwritten. But the FBI has since released footage as Guthrie still has not been found.

(Image credit: Caitlin O'Hara)
item.dc:creator: Ayana Archie
